form.label: Splunk Enterprise Customer Bug RCA Report

ul.li: Root cause analysis based on the customer bugs after 6.3.x (Ember) in JIRA
Excluded the bugs with following resolutions: Withdrawn, Invalid, Cannot Reproduce, Duplicate, Incomplete, Already Fixed, As Designed, Won't Fix

Due to its a part time work, data are only updated to below releases (it will be changed ongoingly)
Ember: 6.3.3.1
Galaxy: 6.4.0 (GA)
Ivory: 6.5.0 (GA)

search.query: index=rca_jira display_version="$version.value$" | stats count by "status" | sort -count
index=rca_jira display_version="$version.value$" |stats count
index=rca_jira display_version="$version.value$" index=rca_jira status="Closed" OR status="Resolved"|stats count

single.searchString: index=rca_jira display_version="$version.value$" status="Closed" OR status="Resolved" |stats count as total | eval backlog=total-[search index=rca_main display_version="$version.value$"| stats count as done | return $done]|fields backlog

drilldown.link: /app/rca/search?q=index=rca_jira display_version="$version.value$" status="Closed" OR status="Resolved" NOT ([search index=rca_main |return 10000 jira_id])&display.page.search.mode=smart&earliest=$earliest$&latest=$latest$

ul.p: There are two analysis perspectives: 1. bug resolution with the code change, 2. bug resolution without code change

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version.value$" |eval codechanged=if(code_change="False", "w/o code change", "w/ code change") | stats count by codechanged

panel.title: w/ code change bugs root cause distribution

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version.value$" code_change!="False" | stats count by root_cause_type_name | sort count
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" code_change!="False" root_cause_type_name="$w_root_cause_type_name$"| stats count by "component"| sort -count

panel.title: w/o code change bugs root cause distribution

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version.value$" code_change="False" | stats count by root_cause_type_name| sort count
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" code_change="False" "root_cause_type_name"="$wo_root_cause_type_name$" | stats count by "component"| sort -count

ul.li: Areas mean core backend, core UI, APPs, security, performance, SDK
Drill down chart shows issue root cause distribution in the selected area

panel.title: w/ code change bugs area distribution

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution ="Fixed" root_cause_type_name!="NULL" |stats count by area
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution="Fixed" area="$w_area$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| stats count by root_cause_type_name| sort -count

panel.title: w/o code change bugs area distribution

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution!="Fixed" root_cause_type_name!="NULL" root_cause_type_name!="Coding flaws" |stats count by area
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution!="Fixed" area="$wo_area$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL" root_cause_type_name!="Coding flaws"| stats count by root_cause_type_name| sort -count

ul.li: Components mean functionality categories, which are almost aligned with JIRA
Below chart only shows Top 10 components sorted by the number of customer issues
Drill down chart shows bug root cause distribution in the selected component

panel.title: w/ code change bugs component distribution

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution="Fixed" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| top limit=10 component
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution="Fixed" component="$w_component$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| stats count by root_cause_sub_type_name| sort -count

panel.title: w/o code change bugs component distribution

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution!="Fixed" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| top limit=10 component
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" Resolution!="Fixed" component="$wo_component$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| stats count by root_cause_sub_type_name| sort -count

html.h1: Customer bug distribution by other quality indicators: regression, migration and platform

search.query: index=rca_main display_version="$version$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"|stats count by regression| eval regression=if(regression="TRUE", "Regression", "Not Regression")
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" regression="$myregression$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| stats count by root_cause_type_name| sort -count
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"|stats count by migration| eval migration=if(migration="TRUE", "Migration", "Not Migration")
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" migration="$mymigration$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| stats count by root_cause_type_name| sort -count
index=rca_main display_version="$version$"| stats count(jira_id) by platform_specific
index=rca_main display_version="$version$" platform_specific="$platform_specific$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| stats count by root_cause_type_name| sort -count

table.searchString: index=rca_main display_version="$version$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"| sort - related_customer_cases | head 10 |table jira_id, title, related_customer_cases ,root_cause_type_name| rename root_cause_type_name as "root cause type" | rename related_customer_cases as "salesforce cases"

index="rca_main" display_version="$version$" root_cause_type_name!="NULL"|fields jira_id, "root_cause_type_name", "root_cause_sub_type_name", "title" | rename title as summary, root_cause_type_name as "root cause type", "root_cause_sub_type_name" as "root cause", jira_id as ticket|table ticket,"root cause type", "root cause", summary
